alert.note: Alert for Bath; Elliott; Estill; Fleming; Lee; Menifee; Montgomery; Morgan; Powell; Rowan; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 10:41AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Powell, Montgomery, northwestern Morgan, Bath, Estill, Menifee, north central Lee, southern Fleming, southern Rowan, northwestern Wolfe and southwestern Elliott Counties through 1115 AM EDT... At 1041 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Reynoldsville to Klondike to 7 miles southeast of Nicholasville. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Mount Sterling, Owingsville, Levee, Prewitt, Klondike, Reynoldsville, Kendall Springs, Wades Mill, Odessa and Flat Creek around 1045 AM EDT. Marshall, Camargo, Peasticks, Craigs, Slate Valley, Bourbon Furnace, Coons Station, Upper Spencer, Olympia and Lower Spencer around 1050 AM EDT. Jeffersonville, Polksville, Lucky Stop, Moore`s Ferry, Bean, Oggs Station, Hope, Walkers Crossing, Olympia Springs and Peeled Oak around 1055 AM EDT. Salt Lick, Midland, Cedar Groves, Clay Lick, Means, Farmers, Ramey and Young Springs around 1100 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Campsites in the Indian Creek area of the Daniel Boone National Forrest, Rothwell, Cornwell, Cogswell, Freestone, Bluestone, Fagan, Tabor, Yale, Haystack, Morehead, Frenchburg, Fox, Zilpo, Palmer, Brandy, Iron Mound, Clearfield, Ratlitt, Bangor, Irvine, Ravenna, Wellington, Wiseman Crossing Station, Pelfrey, Hargett, Lick Fork, Denniston, Craney and Mariba. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 13 and 41. Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 109 and 138. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Bath; Elliott; Estill; Fleming; Lee; Menifee; Montgomery; Morgan; Powell; Rowan; Wolfe
